subject: Re: [junit] JUnit + ant errors

Adrian,

The error means that whatever version of JUnit is being picked up by
ant was compiled with Java 1.5.  Eclipse is most likely its own
internal version of JUnit, hence the difference.  Does Fedora have an
rpm for JUnit 3.8.2?  Good luck,

   David Saff

On 3/28/07, Adrian <adrian.parker@...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I'm running JUnit 3.8.1-3jpp_7fc on Fedora Core 5.  My Java version is
> Sun's own j2sdk1.4.2_12.
>
> I use JNit in Eclipse without error.
>
> When I use JUint in my ant files, as per Apache's tutorial
> (http://ant.apache.org/manual/index.html), I get the following error:
>
> tests:
>     [junit] Running dlcspm4.virtualPlgr.VirtualPlgr_textTest
>     [junit] Exception in thread "main"
> java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: junit/framework/TestListener
> (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:539)
>     [junit]     at
> java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:123)
>     [junit]     at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:251)
>     [junit]     at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:55)
>     [junit]     at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:194)
>     [junit]     at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native
> Method)
>     [junit]     at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:289)
>     [junit]     at
> sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:274)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235)
>     [junit]     at
> java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:539)
>     [junit]     at
> java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:123)
>     [junit]     at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:251)
>     [junit]     at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:55)
>     [junit]     at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:194)
>     [junit]     at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native
> Method)
>     [junit]     at
> java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:187)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:289)
>     [junit]     at
> sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:274)
>     [junit]     at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235)
>     [junit]     at
> java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302)
>     [junit] Test dlcspm4.virtualPlgr.VirtualPlgr_textTest FAILED
>
>
> The major.minor discrepency makes me think its a Java versioning
> issue.  If ant uses `java` and 'javac' (as opposed to some hard coded
> path), then it and eclipse are using the same version, and my tests
> run fine in Eclipse with JUnit.
>
> Any thoughts?
>
